etymologies: modern Latin, named after Jean-Nicholas-Sébastien Allamand (1713–87), Swiss naturalist

definitions: any of a number of tropical shrubs or climbers that bear showy flowers, typically of yellow or purple.

notes.text: Species in several families, in particular members of the genus Allamanda, family Apocynaceae, including the South American yellow allamanda (A. cathartica), which is cultivated as an ornamental

shortDefinitions: several tropical shrubs or climbers which bear showy yellow or purple flowers
